newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Venezuela outlines price, amount of CANTV sale.
newsitem.headline: Venezuela outlines price, amount of CANTV sale.

text.p: Venezuela will put up a total of 289 million shares of telephone company CANTV in its December global share offering, with 50 million shares to be offered on local markets, Venezuelan Investment Fund President Alberto Poletto said.
"The reference range of the share's price, as set by demand, is currently oscillating between $3.07 and $3.50, which is a strong indicator," Poletto said at a press conference.
"But the final price could be higher, according to investors we've met on roadshows," he added.
CANTV shares will be listed abroad as American Depository Receipts (ADRs), each backed by seven local shares, Poletto said, with ADR offer prices currently ranging between $21.50 and $24.50.

"The Venezuelan Investment Fund (FIV) will keep back 75 million shares for possible placement on the Caracas bolsa if local demand is very high," Poletto said. The share offering will see 40 percent of the company's stock placed on local and international markets.

"The company's current and projected finances, perceptions of country risk, the results of the country's economic reform program, all these are incorporated by the market into the share price, which will be finally known November 21," he added.
